result.execSummary:
The defendant Myles E McKinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation apply to both counts.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to the victim and his family addressing the impact on the family. Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to law enforcement officers.
No contact with the victim or his residence.

timeConds.notes: To perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs.  Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as directed by Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
3 months stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Sentence can be served in Marinette County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release granted. 30 days to report.
10/27/15 - Court grants extension to report to jail until 11/05/15.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Atty Schenk makes joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Defendant apologizes for his actions. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews defendants motion to withdraw his plea. Atty Schenk calls Atty Brett Reetz to testify by phone, sworn. Defendant waives attorney/client confidentiality in order for Atty Schenk to question Atty Reetz. Cross by Atty Korb. Defendant testifies, sworn. Cross by Atty Korb. Atty Schenk makes statement on motion. Atty Korb gives argument, asks court to deny motion. Atty Schenk responds. Court makes statement, denies defendants motion to withdraw pleas.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
from Atty Reetz requesting phone appearance for 7/21/15 hearing. Court grants request.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews Atty Schenk's motion to withdraw plea. Court reviews email from Atty Schenk informing that his witness is not available to testify at todays evidentury hearing, requests adjournment of motion hearing. Court concerned about the progress of this case, would like to see matter move along. Court will reschedule motion hearing, need to be ready to proceed at next hearing. Bond remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3.   Court dismisses Cts. 2, 4, 5 & 6 and 3 uncharged counts of recklessly endangering safety but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must submit a DNA Sample to the State of Wisconsin and pay DNA surcharge. Defense/State ask court to set off sentencing until the end of April. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
by Phyllis McKinney

Defendant appears in person with counsel.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz explains defendant thought his court date was yesterday. Court cancels bench warrant. State asks court to impose an additional $1,000 cash bond. Atty Reetz gives argument on bond, asks court to set matter for a plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets additional $500 cash bond, same conditions apply.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions why defendant is not in court. Atty Reetz unsure of defendants whereabouts. State requests bench warrant for non appearance. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing it until 4:00 today to allow Atty Reetz time to locate defendant and make other arrangements for him to appear.
Change of atty

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz just received discovery material, requests a status on 2/12/15. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Myles E McKinney appears by phone along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where he's at in retaining alternate counsel. Atty Gerbers advises SPD is willing to appoint new counsel if that's the route defendant wishes to go. Defendant has been talking to some attorney's, requests until the end of January to secure counsel. Atty Gerbers asks to withdraw from the case at this point. Court not allowing Atty Gerbers to withdraw at this time. If defendant doesn't have counsel in place by the end of January, Court will have SPD appoint counsel and matter will be set for trial. State requests that defendant and his counsel be present in court for next hearing. Court advises defendant he needs to appear in court in person on 2/02/15 unless court advises otherwise. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:45 am.
from Defense requesting phone appearance for Defendant. Per Court, ok.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews letter from Defense requesting Defendant's appearance by phone. Defense advises of multiple contacts with Defendant last week to arrange phone appearance, was advised by Defendant that he was making arrangements to hire private counsel. If Defendant does that, Defense will file written motion to withdraw. Court is not pleased that Defendant did not call in, expects Defendant on phone at next hearing date.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests a status/plea date in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber was just assigned the case, hasn't had time to review all the discovery material. Atty Gerbers requests a status late September. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Myles E McKinney appears by phone along with attorney Eric S Maciolek, who appears in person.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek advises there have been some negotiations since he filed the motion, moves to withdraw his Motion to Dismiss. Atty Maciolek advises defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Motion hearing on May 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Myles E McKinney in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, asks court to set motion hearing re: motion to dismss he filed on Friday. Court will have JA set hearing. Atty Maciolek requests that defendant be allowed to appear by phone for motion hearing. Court grants request for phone appearance. Defense waives time limit for preliminary hearing. Bond remains in effect.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Counts 1, 4, 5 & 6 - Defective Complaint
